reviews.text: The staff was extremely unhelpful and rude. The room we got was old and shabby and nothing like the pictures management has up on the web. The wall paper was torn and our toilet seat broken. They claimed they didn't know about the seat but I fail to see how that could be if they cleaned the bathroom when they turned the room over. It was the first thing I spotted when I entered. I am glad I purchased the room via hotels.com because I was able to have them move me to another hotel. I don't think I would have had much luck with the dealing with hotel management. In fact, they were a bit rude when I said that I was checking out.
reviews.title: Worst hotel I have stayed in
Good value nice place to stay in great location
reviews.text: As other reviewers have pointed out, the location is very central. I can tolerate sub-standard rooms but given the lack of professionalism displayed by the management, I would not stay here or recommend it to anyone.

Last minute Easy jet long weekend in January. Paid 70 euro a night for nice clean room well fitted out. Conintental breakfast included, nice coffee and a bun or two to keep you going. Good location, five minute walk to vatican and Lepanto tube station for access to all other sights.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Location
Good location but not very nice hotel
reviews.text: Nice restraunt a few streets over - good value, nice food, locals only place but very welcoming and good English spoken.L'Antica Griglia Toscana on Via dei Gracchi.

reviews.title: Nice Area, average hotel
reviews.text: Both hotel and restruant highly recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel through lastminute.com and were looking forward to staying at what we thought would be a really swanky looking minimalist design hotel - as the photos on their website and the recent refurbishment suggests.
reviews.title: A bit misleading

likes.liked: — The location - in a nice quiet area
likes.disliked: — The fact it wasn't what we had booked and the awful restaurant staff

reviews.title: True horror
reviews.text: The hotel was easy to find - it occupies the first floor of a building. It is in a quiet residential area of Rome - not far from Vatican City and Piazza del Popolo (which has lots of bars and restaurants) but is a bit of a trek from the other major sites and unfortunately the public transport system is a bit rubbish.

Check-in was easy, however we soon discovered that although we would be having breakfast in Hotel Giuggioli we were actually staying in a different hotel which occupied the 4th floor of the same building - Residenza Dei Quiriti. This was quite a nice hotel however it wasn't very modern - the decor was a bit fussy and stately home-like which is really not to my taste - the check-in staff didn't seem to be able to tell us why we were not actually in the hotel we had booked.
reviews.title: Neighborhood hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast wasn't great - very small consisting of a pastry and one piece of toast - already laid out for you when you arrived so not sure how fresh it was. The 'restaurant' was also staffed by two or three women who shouted at each other constantly which didn't make for a great start to the day.
reviews.title: Fantastic suprise!

likes.disliked: — lack of mirrors in the bathroom and very small towels

reviews.text: Overall a little disappointing.
reviews.title: Quiet Retreat

likes.disliked: — You couldn't bring food into the rooms.

reviews.title: good location,pathetic hotel
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights in the first week of October 2005. Found the location quite convenient. close to the metro station. That was the only thing we liked about this place. I'll list our problems-
-No pressure in the shower. complained to the receptionist but nothing happened.
reviews.title: Great location!!!

reviews.text: -Tiny shower cubicle where there is no place to keep shower gel/soap. You have to open the shower door and pick up them up from the floor. You can imagine how frustrating it is have a shower here.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: -The tiny sachet of shower gel not replaced. Inspite of telling the receptionist they did not replace the shower gel. Was told "sorry,the boss is visiting his mother at the moment." when i called up for the replacements.
reviews.title: Clean, recently decorated but small room
Disappointing
reviews.text: -Had asked for a wake up call at 3:00 am as our taxi was to arrive at 3:30. We did not get a call as anticipated. Just did not go to sleep that night because I knew we will not get the wakeup call.

If you heat somebody send he/she to this hotel it is absolutely disgusting!!! FA SCHIFO!!!!! Do not believe to the picture showed on its website, there is no breakfast room and the "continental brekfast" it's just a ridiculs little dish with a few things on the croissant is dry and unsavoury... DO NOT GO THERE NEVER!!!!!!!!!! pay more money somewhere else but enjoy your stay!!!
reviews.title: Orror!!!

reviews.text: Ciao,
reviews.title: Great for the price!

reviews.text: I booked this hotel, THEN I looked at this website and was very worried. I saw a lot of horrible reviews. Well, I went with an open mind and was very surprised. Maybe there has been a complete renovation, and staff change since some of the reviews, or people were just being picky. The hotel is about a 5 minute walk from the Lapanto metro stop. The man and woman at the front desk were extremely helpful upon our arrival. Providing us with a tourist map and writing notes and directions on it. We were escorted to our room and shown how to work the AC. The bathroom was adequate size and the shower had decent pressure. Although not near most of the attractions of Rome, it is only a 10 minute walk to the Vatican museum line, which is the best place to start a tour of Rome in the morning. Breakfast was good; cereal, yogurt, pastries, coffee and juice. The only complaint I have is that the second bed in the room was too small. My mom and her friend stayed in the queen size bed and I was assigned to the single. I am 6 foot tall and from the ankle down was hanging off the end. We paid $135 USD and were not disappointed. I cannot count how many European hotels I have spent the night in, and this was not the best, but far far far from the worst. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Stay away from this awful, horrible hotel!

likes.disliked: — impossible to find, no internet, lousy service

reviews.title: location gggggrrrreeeaaat
reviews.text: This hotel was a nightmare! It was almost impossible to find; wedged into a dilapidated building that had many lousy little hotels. We checked into a hotel that we thought was Residenza Dei Quiriti, only to find out that it was someone's home that rented a few rooms to pensioners (poor old folks). We finally found by accident ( the wrong floor pushed on the elevator) the crappy hotel that we had booked on the internet. It was better that the flop house room we had mistakenly thought was ours, but it wasn't what we had seen on the websites. The desk clerk spoke NO English, only Italian, there was no internet connection or any possibility of getting on line, there was no coffee machine, clock, tea kettle - only a lousy TV, and lumpy bed. A lady started agruing with her husband every morning at 6, waking us up. The worst was that because of a lousy reservation system, we mistakenly had reserved 3 rooms instead of one, so the stupid manager insisted on having us pay for all 3 rooms for the first night. The so-called breaksfast was bad coffee and stale rolls. This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in my life. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL UNLESS YOU ENJOY MISERY!

reviews.title: Rudeness at It's Best.
reviews.text: just back form spending 5 days in this hotel, i have read the other comments and they are right, hotel is right beside vatican, near to metro and lovely resturants.
